yeah we don't need that stuff why won't

because it's not real Chinese food
we don't eat fried rice that looks like

don't eat deep fried cheese that look
like a ninja star and honestly neither
should you I'm a to the best food in the
restaurant is served after the
restaurant closes so after the day is
over the cooks will start cranking out

why you need to become friends with the

children so you get invited to these
meals especially if you don't live close
to a major metropolitan city this may be
the only way you get access to authentic
Chinese food number three we get sick of
Chinese food too you know I went back to
China for two years and after six months
I would have traded my left arm for a
burger
I needed something else besides Chinese
food luckily there were McDonald's and
KFC in China back then but they weren't
cheap you know eating at KFC where
McDonald's in China is like eating
luxury food because they're so expensive
compared to all the other foods
anyway the staff in Chinese restaurants
get the urge for some good old greasy

because the pizza guys don't always want
to eat pizza you know that was probably
the only period of my life I would ever
call a Pizza Hut Delivery line and what

Chinese food
number four we give you nicknames now
you may think you're on first-name basis
with the staff at your go to Chinese
restaurants play what you don't know is
that you probably also have a nickname
because when the staff of a Chinese
restaurant communicate with each other
about regular customers they rarely use
names because that's just too hard to
remember so you will get nicknames based
on either a physical feature that you
have or the dish that you always get for
example at our restaurant there was a
regular customer who always ordered a
pepper steak with a ton of hot oil so
his nickname was spicy steak but don't
take this as an insult it's kind of cool
like whatever spicy steak will show up
at our place the waiter will go into the
kitchen and be like hey spicy steak is
here and then the cooks knew exactly
what to make for him number five the
person behind the cash register is
always a family member Chinese people
don't trust employees with cash this is
why you never see anyone behind the
register at a Chinese restaurant besides
the owner the owners spouse or their
kids number six
fortune cookies this is something
everyone who's worked at a Chinese
restaurant hate have you ever done this
before you get a fortune cookie and you
don't know what it means
so you flag down a Chinese staff member
and be like hey what is this fortune
mean then we look at it and we smile at
you and we say something that's
philosophical we're kind of deep and
then we walk away and you're left pretty
satisfied with that answer but here's
the thing yeah we made that up we don't
know what that fortune means you know
why we don't know what that fortune
means because it wasn't a Chinese person
that wrote that fortune oh and if you
ever get a fortune that just blank and
we tell you it means that you control

really just a printer error number seven

number eight using the term law why
here's the thing if you're not Asian
then you will be known as law white

you of course the law whiting is not
just limited to people who work in
Chinese restaurants but you'll probably
hear this term a lot there if you don't
know what law why is law why means
foreigner and it's a term that typically
Chinese people in China uses to describe
foreigners but then these Chinese people
left China and migrated to places like
the US Canada Europe Australia anywhere
else outside of China but they kept
using this term to refer to anybody who
is not Asian but it doesn't make any
sense because actually the Chinese
people who migrated outside of China
they are now the law why well we keep
